page.title: 14HISTORY OF EARITH
page.content:
{Earith's}name is based from Hithe, which means a{landing place.} When you come down the{River Ouse}you can stop at Earith where the land is higher than the fens around. Earith is called {"The Gateway to the Fens"}because as boats get to Earith they enter the {Fens.}The Romans were some of the first settlers.They used the river for {washing, drinking, cooking}and{goods {transportation.}They ate wild fowl, eels, fish and other small animals. This position on the river helped with their defense. After the romans left, other settlers came using the local building materials, food and water. Soon, Earith became important because of its markets. In 1318,{The Bishop of {Ely}gave permission for a{weekly {market}and{regular fairs.}
(Chistopher Young aged 10)
